Articles.Content:
Download it here

Just whack a couple of docking ports on the attachment nodes for the best experience.

This part is the outcome of this tutorial which is pretty much now finished, minus a couple of layout tweaks.

Kerbal To Pro: Modelling with 3ds Max

Awesome, I was looking into what it would take to make this. Good Job! Think about this for a future project: Take the section from the Saturn V replica on Spaceport (http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/apollo-lmcsm-replica/) as a starting point for a Skylab model. Just need to add the docking port (might even just modify this one) and make solar panels. based on this, you could totally do it, and people would love you!

Good Job,

KGas
How about adding a radiator and a small experiment airlock to it? With a small texture change (brown-ish intead of orange), it'd work perfectly well as the Rassvet module for the ISS.

This is fantastic! I love it!

Edited June 27, 2013 by Frandsen

How about adding a radiator and a small experiment airlock to it? With a small texture change (brown-ish intead of orange), it'd work perfectly well as the Rassvet module for the ISS.

This.

the person who was going to make rassvet for the ISS pack left the pack for complicated reasons, so they need this.

(any one know what type of port the Buran Docks to?(Mir probe docking port or Mir drogue docking port))
Buran should dock to a special APAS, but that's not in the current Soviet pack. Just use a Clamp-o-tron.

There is an APAS in KOSMOS pack, but to use it with buran I first had to resize it to roughly proper scale (so it didn't look stupid on Kristall - IIRC it is smaller than APAS-89) and than add top node to Buran docking port (and remove the animation module, unfortunately - though IRL that docking port didn't expand AFAIK) so I could attach APAS there.

The Buran airlock is completely unrealistic ATM. Kosmos pack APAS works, but not too well.

Also, I found that this DC is too big. Try using rescale factor = 0.75 and move both nodes by 1 unit outwards, then it works much better.
This might help for compairsion
Have you contacted bobcat and co over at the international ISS dev thread about making rassvet for them?

Have you contacted bobcat and co over at the international ISS dev thread about making rassvet for them?

Didn't know they were looking for a modeller.
They are, you should ask them.
Well, not really "looking" for a modeler, but this is a community project, you can contribute.

Still loving your work, it rly compleats MIR

BTW Would you consider making a Pirs docking module ?
Fustek has one, seems small though. What mod did you use for the spekter module radio telescope?

It's built into the Spekter module it's self...

Right click and toggle....
It looks like that docking module needs to be shrunk just a little bit
PLZ download link error kerbalspaceprogram.com XD

The original author is unavailable. I recall him giving me an informal permission to rescale/reskin it, so I'm considering including this in Community ISS pack. That said, I hope somebody (BobCat, maybe?) makes a higher quality DC/Rassvet.

Fustek has one, seems small though. What mod did you use for the spekter module radio telescope?

I should point out that the Kirs Docking Module included in FusTek is not meant to be an accurate representation of the real-life Pirs.
Could you please provide a mirror for this module please. Spaceport is closed
I've included this into the MIR pack. Check out BobCat Ind. new thread.
